title: 1D kinematics - v-t graph from motion diagram

content.description: A constant force is exerted on a block, causing the block to move across a horizontal surface in the positive <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> </math>-direction. There is nonnegligible friction between the block and the horizontal surface. The diagram shows the position of the block at <math alttext="0.5 second" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> time intervals.
content.question:
Which of the following provides a velocity-time graph that could correspond to the diagram and provides correct reasoning?

Velocity-Time Graph
 Reasoning

A

The distance traveled by the block during each half-second interval increases, so the velocity of the block must increase.

B

The block is traveling in the positive <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction, so the velocity graph must have a positive slope.

C

The force of friction exerted on the block causes the acceleration of the block to decrease.

D

The block reaches a constant speed.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
